article.headline: Weber St. 89, Western St., Colo. 62
article.story: OGDEN, Utah -- Damian Lillard scored 18 of his game-high 20 points in the second half Tuesday night to lead Weber State to an 89-62 win over Western State, Colo. Steve Panos, who finished with 14 points, scored five early in the second half for the Wildcats (1-3). Lillard ended the stretch with a 3-pointer to give the Wildcats a 43-39 lead less than three minutes into the half. Dan Biber opened the second half with a 3-pointer to give the Division II Mountaineers (2-1) a 39-31 lead, but after that the Wildcats went on a 35-6 run over the next 10 minutes. Western State got its first lead of the game when Alex Hart's long jumper gave the Mountaineers a 9-7 advantage. The lead changed hands eight times before the end of the half, with the Mountaineers leading 36-31 at the break. Hart led Western State with 12 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
